title: nt.number theory - Proof for new deterministic primality test possible?
body: Conjecture: Let $n \in \mathbb{N}$ and $n$ odd. Then the number $N=2^2 + n^2$ is prime, if and only if $N$ divides $2^{(N-1)/2} + 1$ .
